titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Oversize Ms. Codex 62: Legal proceedings

availability.licence: These images and the content of Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts Oversize Ms. Codex 62: Legal proceedings are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. notesStmt.note: Date taken from dealer's notes and Zacour-Hirsch.
Many of the leaves are frayed and torn. The edges of many leaves appear to have been worn or eaten away.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Proceedings of a suit between the brothers Constantius and Daniel de Vicario and Jacobus de Pego, syndicus fiscalis. Notarized by Jacobus de Guida (f. 109r).

supportDesc.extent: 111 leaves : 295 x 207 (210 x 125) mm. bound to 310 x 220 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, i (modern paper) + 109 + i (modern paper); [1-109]; modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto.

collation.p: [i], I-II²⁵, III⁴[?], 1, [i]. Quire III is too tightly bound for its construction to be discerned; it is apparently four bifolia.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a notarial cursive script.

history.provenance: Sold in the collection of Carlo Morbio, 1889, no. 716.
Appears in L. Rosenthal's catalog 120 (1910), no. 76.
